nodes.text: Xenu's paradox was the paradoxical statement—attributed to Xenu—that no matter how fast an object or person traveled, it would be unable to close the gap between itself and another object. During the battle of Skye, Jedi Padawan Halagad Ventor was reminded of the paradox while chasing Separatist scientist Zeta Magnus through the corridors of his citadel.

Xenu's paradox was first mentioned in SkyeWalkers: A Clone Wars Story, by Abel G. Peña. The concept and the name of the paradox closely resemble one of Zeno's paradoxes, attributed to the ancient real-world philosopher Zeno.
